page.title: 12Landscape & Build.-Ide Hill
page.content: {Yorkshill Farm} Was built in 1476 as a large Wealden Hall house of two bays length(30 feet) and two storeys in height, the upper story being jettied. The interior beams are large with a hugh roof-truss with an octagonal king-post. A fireplace and chimney were added in Stuart times and in the Georgian period a whole new brick front was added with new windows completely hiding the timber framing. A substantial extension has been added to the rear in recent times so that the Wealden 'core' is now totally encased.
